text:
TAWAN DAVIS: The average
American family makes $53,000
a year, give or take.

There is a dramatic need for
quality housing in the United

States for people who form
the backbone of the economy.

Some of the most dramatic
transitions in Philadelphia

where property values have gone
up 1,600% in 10 or 15 years.

People who have lived
there for generations

can no longer
afford to be there.

House to be demolished, empty
lot, house to be demolished.

And so this whole
neighborhood is transitioning.
I started Steinbridge in 2016.

We invest in major cities, in
transitioning neighborhoods.

We are buying them, renovating
them to a very high spec,

and then renting
them out to neighbors

who want to stay and be a
part of the neighborhood.
SPEAKER 2: Look at that!

TAWAN DAVIS: I grew up
in Portland, Oregon.

My family's been there
for almost 100 years.

We have been slaves
in Mississippi,
sharecroppers in Arkansas.
I was born to a single mother.

I was raised at or
around the poverty limit.
We run a nine-figure business.

The statistical likelihood of
that is infinitesimally small.

SPEAKER 3: [INAUDIBLE]
is really a challenge.
TAWAN DAVIS: Yes, I understand.

Every single day there are
reasons to stop, to quit,
or to give up.

There are challenges
from the beginning
that seem insurmountable.

The more opposition
I have faced,

the more deeply convicted I
have become about our success.

I've only got so
much time, and I

want to use the time
that I have to make

a maximum impact on my
life, the life of my family,

and the life the
world around me.

And building a successful and
thriving and impactful business
has been my way to do that.
